item.name: label
item.presentation:
In collision A, two air pucks bounce off of each other.  The system is both pucks.

In collision B, two air pucks stick together.  The  system is both pucks.

item.name: What can we say about whether system momentum stays the same in these collisions?
item.label: answer
item.presentation: r>>>>>The momentum stays the same in A and B |The momentum stays the same in A, but not in B |The momentum stays the same in B, but not in A |The momentum changes in both

item.name: What can we say about whether system kinetic energy stays the same in these collisions?
item.label: answer
item.presentation: r>>>>>The kinetic energy stay the same in A and B |The kinetic energy stay the same in A, but not in B |The kinetic energy stay the same in B, but not in A |The kinetic energy changes in both |The kinetic energy might stay the same in A (we don't know) but doesn't stay the same in B. |The kinetic energy might stay the same in B (we don't know) but doesn't stay the same in A.
